SEARCH
Package ru.introguzzle.parsers.common.io.resource

Interface ResourceLoader<R>

Type Parameters:
R - the type of the document resulting from parsing the resource (e.g., YAMLDocument)
All Known Implementing Classes:
ClassResourceLoader
public interface ResourceLoader<R>
Interface for loading and parsing resource files into structured documents. The ResourceLoader interface provides methods for loading resource data from specified file paths and converting it into objects of type R using an associated parser. It supports both mandatory loading, which throws exceptions on failure, and optional loading, which gracefully handles errors by returning an empty result.

  • Method Details

    • getParser

      @NotNull @NotNull BaseParser<R> getParser()
      Retrieves the parser instance used for parsing resource files. The parser is responsible for converting raw resource data into structured documents.
      Returns:
      a non-null BaseParser instance for parsing resources

    • load

      @NotNull R load(@NotNull @NotNull String path)
      Loads and parses a resource file from the specified path. This method attempts to load the resource file located at the given path and parses its contents into an object of type R using the associated parser.
      Parameters:
      path - the file system path to the resource file
      Returns:
      a non-null instance of R representing the parsed resource
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the resource file cannot be loaded or parsed successfully

    • tryLoad

      @NotNull default @NotNull Optional<R> tryLoad(@NotNull @NotNull String path)
      Attempts to load and parse a resource file from the specified path without throwing an exception. This method tries to load and parse the resource file located at the given path. If the loading or parsing process fails for any reason, it returns an empty Optional instead of propagating the exception.
      Parameters:
      path - the file system path to the resource file
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the parsed resource of type R if successful, or Optional.empty() if an error occurs during loading or parsing
